name: Amazon Rainforest, Brazil
facts: The Amazon Rainforest is losing thousands of square kilometers each year due to illegal logging, mining, and agriculture, threatening global biodiversity.

name: Lake Chad, Africa
facts: Lake Chad has shrunk by over 90% since the 1960s due to climate change and excessive water usage, impacting millions who depend on it.

name: Aral Sea, Kazakhstan
facts: Once the fourth-largest lake in the world, the Aral Sea has almost completely dried up due to river diversion for agriculture.

name: Great Barrier Reef, Australia
facts: The Great Barrier Reef is experiencing massive coral bleaching due to rising ocean temperatures and acidification.

name: Mt. Kilimanjaro, Tanzania
facts: Mount Kilimanjaro's glaciers have decreased by over 80% in the last century due to warming temperatures and changing weather patterns.

name: Mekong River Delta, Vietnam
facts: The Mekong River Delta is sinking and shrinking due to upstream damming, sand mining, and sea-level rise, threatening agriculture and livelihoods.

name: Chernobyl, Ukraine
facts: The 1986 Chernobyl disaster released massive amounts of radioactive material, rendering the surrounding area uninhabitable for thousands of years.

name: Yellow River, China
facts: The Yellow River has been heavily polluted and altered by dams and agriculture, affecting water quality and downstream ecosystems.

name: Colorado River, USA
facts: The Colorado River no longer reaches the sea due to extensive damming and water extraction, impacting ecosystems and agriculture.

name: Dead Sea, Jordan
facts: The Dead Sea is rapidly shrinking due to water diversion from the Jordan River and mineral extraction, leading to sinkholes and habitat loss.

name: Lake Urmia, Iran
facts: Lake Urmia has shrunk dramatically due to prolonged droughts and excessive irrigation, threatening regional biodiversity.

name: Greenland Ice Sheet, Greenland
facts: The Greenland Ice Sheet is melting at an accelerating rate due to global warming, contributing significantly to sea-level rise.

name: Okjökull Glacier, Iceland
facts: Okjökull was Iceland’s first glacier lost to climate change, officially declared 'dead' in 2014.

name: Jakarta, Indonesia
facts: Jakarta is one of the fastest-sinking cities in the world due to groundwater extraction and sea-level rise.

name: Bangladesh Coast
facts: The Bangladesh coast faces severe flooding and displacement due to sea-level rise and intense cyclones linked to climate change.

name: Tuvalu, Pacific Ocean
facts: Tuvalu is at risk of becoming uninhabitable due to rising sea levels, making it a symbol of climate vulnerability.

name: New Orleans, USA
facts: New Orleans has experienced catastrophic flooding, most notably during Hurricane Katrina, worsened by wetland loss and rising seas.

name: Miami, USA
facts: Miami faces regular flooding from sea-level rise, with climate change threatening its long-term habitability and infrastructure.

name: Kiribati
facts: Kiribati is among the first nations expected to be submerged by rising seas, forcing future climate migration.

name: Maldives
facts: The Maldives, composed of low-lying islands, faces existential threats from rising sea levels.

name: Fiji
facts: Fiji is experiencing stronger storms and coastal erosion due to climate change, displacing coastal communities.

name: Marshall Islands
facts: The Marshall Islands are losing land to the sea, with rising tides flooding homes and contaminating freshwater supplies.

name: Venice, Italy
facts: Venice is sinking and regularly floods due to sea-level rise and subsidence, threatening its historical heritage.

name: Cape Town, South Africa
facts: Cape Town narrowly avoided running out of water during its 2018 drought, highlighting climate vulnerability in urban areas.

name: Himalayas, Nepal
facts: Glaciers in the Himalayas are rapidly melting, threatening water supplies for millions in South Asia.

name: Fukushima, Japan
facts: The 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster contaminated land and ocean, displacing thousands and raising concerns about nuclear safety.

name: Beijing, China
facts: Beijing frequently suffers from severe air pollution due to industrial activity and traffic, affecting public health.

name: Sundarbans, India/Bangladesh
facts: The Sundarbans mangrove forest is threatened by rising sea levels and increased salinity, endangering its unique biodiversity.

name: Sahara Desert, Niger
facts: The Sahara Desert is expanding southward, contributing to desertification and displacement in the Sahel region.

name: Gobi Desert, China
facts: The Gobi Desert is growing due to overgrazing, deforestation, and climate change, pushing into once-arable land.

name: Siberian Tundra, Russia
facts: The Siberian tundra is thawing due to rising temperatures, releasing large amounts of methane and destabilizing ecosystems.

name: Lake Poopó, Bolivia
facts: Lake Poopó has almost completely dried up due to climate change and water diversion, devastating local livelihoods.

name: Borneo, Indonesia
facts: Borneo's rainforests are being cleared rapidly for palm oil plantations, threatening orangutan habitats and biodiversity.

name: Coral Triangle, Philippines
facts: The Coral Triangle, a marine biodiversity hotspot, is threatened by overfishing, pollution, and coral bleaching.

name: Antarctic Peninsula, Antarctica
facts: The Antarctic Peninsula is one of the fastest-warming places on Earth, leading to ice shelf collapses and rising sea levels.

name: Niger River, Mali
facts: The Niger River is increasingly threatened by drought, desertification, and upstream dam projects.

name: Oroville Dam, USA
facts: The Oroville Dam crisis in 2017 highlighted aging infrastructure and the increasing risk of extreme weather events.

name: Dakar, Senegal
facts: Dakar faces severe coastal erosion and flooding driven by rising sea levels and unregulated construction.

name: Sydney, Australia
facts: Sydney has endured extreme heatwaves and bushfires, both intensified by climate change.

name: Murray-Darling Basin, Australia
facts: The Murray-Darling Basin is under severe stress from over-extraction of water and prolonged droughts.

name: Athabasca Oil Sands, Canada
facts: The Athabasca Oil Sands are a major source of carbon emissions and have dramatically altered the surrounding boreal forest.

name: Nile Delta, Egypt
facts: The Nile Delta is shrinking due to sea-level rise and damming upstream, threatening agriculture and settlements.

name: Hoover Dam, USA
facts: Water levels at the Hoover Dam have dropped drastically due to prolonged drought and overuse in the Southwest.

name: Yosemite, USA
facts: Yosemite has faced increased wildfires and tree loss due to warming temperatures and prolonged dry seasons.

name: Rondônia, Brazil
facts: Rondônia has seen rapid deforestation for cattle grazing, contributing significantly to Amazon rainforest loss.

name: Caribbean Coral Reefs
facts: Caribbean coral reefs have experienced mass bleaching events due to ocean warming and pollution.

name: Hurricane Katrina Flood Zone, USA
facts: The Hurricane Katrina flood zone highlights the vulnerabilities of coastal cities to climate-amplified storms.

name: Dubai Coastline, UAE
facts: Dubai’s massive coastal developments have reshaped marine ecosystems and increased shoreline vulnerability.

name: Mississippi River Delta, USA
facts: The Mississippi River Delta is rapidly losing land due to erosion, subsidence, and rising sea levels.

name: Mount Everest Base Camp, Nepal
facts: Glacial retreat near Mount Everest Base Camp is accelerating, exposing rock and altering climbing routes.

name: Timbuktu, Mali
facts: Timbuktu is facing encroaching desertification due to climate change and land degradation in the Sahel region.

name: Glacier National Park, USA
facts: Glacier National Park has lost the majority of its glaciers over the past century due to warming temperatures.

name: Alps, Europe
facts: The Alps are losing snow cover and glaciers rapidly, threatening water supplies and winter tourism.

name: Andes Mountains, South America
facts: Glaciers in the Andes are melting quickly, reducing freshwater availability for millions in the region.

name: Patagonia, Argentina
facts: Patagonia’s glaciers are among the fastest melting in the world due to rising global temperatures.

name: Mount Elgon, Uganda
facts: Mount Elgon’s ecosystem is under threat from deforestation and land use pressures, endangering local water sources.

name: Sequoia National Forest, USA
facts: Sequoia National Forest has suffered from severe wildfires fueled by prolonged drought and insect infestations.

name: Tar Creek, USA
facts: Tar Creek is one of the most toxic Superfund sites in the U.S., polluted by decades of lead and zinc mining.

name: Love Canal, USA
facts: Love Canal became a symbol of industrial pollution after a toxic waste dump caused a health crisis in the 1970s.

name: Minamata, Japan
facts: Minamata suffered one of the worst industrial mercury poisoning disasters, affecting generations of residents.

name: Bhopal, India
facts: The 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy exposed over half a million people to toxic chemicals in one of the worst industrial disasters.

name: Exxon Valdez Spill Site, USA
facts: The Exxon Valdez oil spill devastated Alaskan marine life and remains one of the most destructive oil spills in history.

name: Deepwater Horizon Spill Site, USA
facts: The Deepwater Horizon disaster spilled millions of barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico, with long-lasting ecological damage.

name: Norilsk, Russia
facts: Norilsk is one of the most polluted cities in the world due to decades of heavy metal smelting operations.

name: Niger Delta, Nigeria
facts: The Niger Delta suffers from massive oil spills and gas flaring, devastating the environment and local communities.

name: Gulf of Mexico Dead Zone, USA
facts: The Gulf of Mexico Dead Zone is caused by agricultural runoff, creating low-oxygen waters that kill marine life.

name: Delhi, India
facts: Delhi frequently ranks among the most polluted cities globally, with hazardous air quality levels impacting public health.

name: Mexico City, Mexico
facts: Mexico City faces air pollution, water scarcity, and ground subsidence due to rapid urbanization and overuse of resources.

name: Cairo, Egypt
facts: Cairo experiences severe smog and water issues, exacerbated by population growth and limited natural resources.

name: Lagos, Nigeria
facts: Lagos is rapidly urbanizing with challenges including flooding, pollution, and strain on infrastructure due to climate and population pressures.

name: São Paulo, Brazil
facts: São Paulo faces urban air pollution and water stress due to sprawling growth and frequent droughts.

name: Dhaka, Bangladesh
facts: Dhaka suffers from extreme air and water pollution, worsened by rapid population growth and industrial waste.

name: Karachi, Pakistan
facts: Karachi is facing rising sea levels and heatwaves, compounding its urban pollution and infrastructure challenges.

name: Manila, Philippines
facts: Manila is highly vulnerable to typhoons and flooding due to climate change and poor drainage systems.

name: Central Kalimantan, Indonesia
facts: Central Kalimantan has seen extensive deforestation and peatland fires linked to palm oil expansion.

name: Sumatra, Indonesia
facts: Sumatra’s rainforests are disappearing rapidly due to logging and agriculture, threatening endangered species.

name: Chaco Forest, Paraguay
facts: The Chaco Forest is losing tree cover at alarming rates due to ranching and unsustainable land use.

name: Papua New Guinea
facts: Papua New Guinea’s forests are under pressure from logging and mining, affecting indigenous communities.

name: Belize Barrier Reef
facts: The Belize Barrier Reef faces coral bleaching from warming seas and damage from tourism and fishing.

name: Florida Keys, USA
facts: The Florida Keys are losing coral and land to rising seas and hurricanes intensified by climate change.

name: Seychelles
facts: Seychelles’ beaches and corals are at risk due to rising seas and ocean acidification.

name: Red Sea Coral Reefs
facts: Red Sea coral reefs, once thought resilient, are showing signs of bleaching from marine heatwaves.

name: Marshall Islands Reefs
facts: Coral reefs around the Marshall Islands are dying off due to warming waters and rising sea levels.

name: Great Salt Lake, USA
facts: The Great Salt Lake has reached record lows due to prolonged drought and water diversion.

name: Mono Lake, USA
facts: Mono Lake has been shrinking due to water exports, threatening its unique saline ecosystem.

name: Loess Plateau, China
facts: The Loess Plateau has suffered from severe erosion and desertification, though reforestation efforts are improving it.

name: Mount Kenya, Kenya
facts: Glaciers on Mount Kenya are melting fast, jeopardizing water sources for surrounding communities.

name: Lake Victoria, Africa
facts: Lake Victoria is under threat from overfishing, invasive species, and increasing water pollution.

name: Lake Baikal, Russia
facts: Lake Baikal, the world’s deepest lake, faces pollution and warming that threatens its unique species.

name: Indus River, Pakistan
facts: The Indus River is drying due to glacial melt and upstream water diversion, affecting millions of people.

name: Yellowstone National Park, USA
facts: Yellowstone’s climate is changing, impacting its iconic geysers, wildlife, and fire patterns.

name: Volga River Delta, Russia
facts: The Volga River Delta is shrinking due to water regulation and pollution, reducing fish populations and wetlands.

name: Zambezi River, Zambia
facts: The Zambezi River is impacted by erratic rainfall and dam projects, threatening hydroelectric and ecosystem stability.

name: Ivindo National Park, Gabon
facts: Ivindo National Park, a biodiversity haven, is at risk from illegal logging and mining expansion.

name: Manú National Park, Peru
facts: Manú National Park, one of the most biodiverse places on Earth, faces illegal road construction and logging threats.

name: Amazon Basin, Peru
facts: The Amazon Basin in Peru is losing forest to illegal mining and agriculture, endangering indigenous territories.

name: Bogotá River, Colombia
facts: The Bogotá River is one of the most polluted rivers in Colombia due to untreated industrial and domestic waste.

name: San Francisco Bay, USA
facts: San Francisco Bay is affected by rising seas and habitat loss from development and shoreline hardening.

name: Salton Sea, USA
facts: The Salton Sea is shrinking rapidly, exposing toxic dust and threatening surrounding communities.

name: Jharia Coalfield, India
facts: Jharia is plagued by underground coal fires and severe air pollution, impacting thousands of residents.
